Central Eurasians & Oceanians and Clovid Americans  

Old Shamanic roots [WHG](WHG.html), Totem cult  

One needs to distinguish between subclades C1 C2 Bornean C3 Mongolian C4 Australian  
C-M130  
C-M217 Turk Siberian American  

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e6/Haplogroup_C_%28Y-DNA%29_2017.png)  

What this image does not show is the connection between indigenous Americans and Mesolithic Europeans.  

https://duckduckgo.com/?q=haplogroup+C&t=fpas&ia=images&iax=images  

Anatolian and Early European Farmers [EEF](EEF.html) see [G2](G2.html) 

Genome lives on, parental lineages died out:  
The individual analyzed belongs to haplogroup C1a2 of the Y chromosome, which has been found in some of the early WHG's. It has also been observed that this individual belongs to the mitocondrial haplogroup K2b. Both paternal and maternal lineages are rare in the current Eurasian populations.  

Nowadays mostly [Turk](Turk.html)  

Explaining similarities between all [Eurasian](Eurasian.html) languages, if only as a substratum!
